reviews.text: This hotel is so convenient for EVERYTHING near and far,having the rail station and local transport literally at the front door. The town is a couple of minutes walk away. Look no further.

reviews.title: The Meridian Hotel
reviews.text: My experience at Le Meridien has truly been amazing! The staff are absolutely incredible and although it may not be the most modern hotel with decor, it makes up for in special touches noticed throughout the hotel. Such "touches" include incredible room service, fantastic, english speaking staff, amazing room diffuser, fabulous location to town and the train station and so much more. My husband and I are staying at the hotel for the next few weeks and I truly could not feel more at home in this fabulous Germany gem!
Wondeful hotel the best in the city, great breakfast. You can walk all over the heart of themain square and enjoy Nuremberger sauages at teh nearbt beer hall.

reviews.text: For the price paid and the location I would say that the Grand represents average value for money, especially if like us you don't intend to spend too much time in your room.
reviews.title: Grand hotel, in the art neuvo style

reviews.text: For a short weekend trip to Nuremberg I've choosen the Le Meridien Grand Hotel. The hotel is ideally located in the city, accross the train station and at the entrance to the historic city centre. I had a great room on one of the corners, very spacious. The lobby is very traditional with a lot of marble, just the furniture there should be replaced.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location

reviews.text: I originally booked a room in Furth, a suburb of Nuremberg and then thought better of it and switched to this grande dame just beyond the wall and near the train station when I found a good deal for it on a hotel website. So glad we did. Nuremberg is larger than we remembered and traffic in and out is no picnic. Also from everything I read, Furth isn’t loaded with places to dine. And we sure enjoyed walking about Nuremberg in the evenings.
reviews.title: Meridien grand--grand hotel, grander buffet

likes.disliked: — Bathrooms nice but rooms could use some sprucing and lightening up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don’t usually like large chain hotels but I was quite happy with this one. For one thing we got a great deal. Doubles usually run about 300 euros or more per the information posted in the room, so our web booking price of 165 or 170 euros per night was a really good one. The room could use another renovation but it was ok and the beautiful old marble inlaid bathroom was large and lovely, except for the over forceful shower which overwhelmed the flimsy shower curtain.
reviews.title: charming

reviews.text: The public rooms were appropriately grand and in art deco style, another of my favorites. The restaurant advertised a special candlelight buffet for Saturday night and we signed up for it. Truly one of the best buffets I’ve ever had. Lovely trays of cold appetizers—salmon, various salads, herring, balsamic marinated cippoline onions. Then every imaginable meat with a variety of sauces and veggie accompaniments—beef, lamb, chicken even wild duck. Also multiple dessert offerings of which I selected the fresh strawberries and the many cheeses.
reviews.title: Old fashioned charm

reviews.text: Nice piano arrangements were played throughout the meal. The place also does a big Sunday brunch. These buffet meals are justifiably popular not just with guests but with locals, so much so, that they’ve added on two special rooms fitted out just for their buffet offerings. It really is an exceptional dining opportunity. It’s accompanied by red and white wines all part of the 40 euro per person charge. No wonder the locals flock to this place.
reviews.title: Superbly located Grand Hotel

reviews.text: If in Nuremberg again, I would definitely return for the Meridien’s buffet extravaganza, and I would be perfectly happy staying in the hotel again. I might, however, be more inclined to try out the Drei Raben which we kept walking by on our way further into the old town. It’s a small hotel of 25 rooms with a modern look and apparently themed guest rooms that gets good reviews on Trip Advisor and has rates even lower than we paid at the Meridien.
